Many thanks for confirming some more details about your horror movie preferences.  Loading.....

1. Suspiria (1977) - An American ballet student studies at a prestigious dance academy in Europe, and soon realizes that the school is a front for something sinister amid a series of grisly murders.

2. The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (1974) - Five friends on a road trip fall victim to a family of cannibalistic killers in this classic and influential slasher film.

3. The Thing (1982) - A group of American researchers in Antarctica are hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assimilates and imitates other living organisms.

4. Night of the Living Dead (1968) - A group of strangers are trapped in a farmhouse and must fight off a horde of flesh-eating zombies in this groundbreaking horror classic.

5. The Shining (1980) - A family takes up residence in an isolated hotel for the winter, where the father becomes influenced by a sinister presence and turns against his wife and son.

6. A Nightmare on Elm Street (1984) - A group of teenagers are stalked and murdered in their dreams by Freddy Krueger, a disfigured child killer who was burned alive by the parents of his victims.

7. Dawn of the Dead (1978) - A group of survivors take refuge in a shopping mall during a zombie apocalypse in this sequel to Night of the Living Dead.

8. The Evil Dead (1981) - A group of college students go on a weekend trip to a remote cabin in the woods, where they accidentally unleash a horde of flesh-possessing demons.

9. Hellraiser (1987) - A group of friends accidentally summon a group of sadistic supernatural beings known as Cenobites, who offer them unimaginable pain and pleasure.

10. Candyman (1992) - A graduate student researching urban legends about a hook-handed killer inadvertently summons him, and he begins terrorizing the residents of a housing project.
